org.opends.server.tools.status

Class StatusCliArgumentParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opends.server.util.args.ArgumentParser
      • org.opends.server.util.args.SubCommandArgumentParser
        • org.opends.server.admin.client.cli.SecureConnectionCliParser
          • org.opends.server.tools.status.StatusCliArgumentParser

  • public class StatusCliArgumentParser
extends SecureConnectionCliParser
    The class that is used to parse the arguments provided in the status command line.

                               throws ArgumentException
        Initialize Global option.
        Parameters:
        outStream - The output stream used for the usage.
        Throws:

      • isInteractive

        public boolean isInteractive()
        Tells whether the user specified to have an interactive status CLI or not. This method must be called after calling parseArguments.
        Returns:
        true if the user specified to have an interactive status CLI and false otherwise.

      • isScriptFriendly

        public boolean isScriptFriendly()
        Tells whether the user specified to have a script-friendly output or not. This method must be called after calling parseArguments.
        Returns:
        true if the user specified to have a script-friendly output and false otherwise.

      • getRefreshPeriod

        public int getRefreshPeriod()
        Returns the refresh period (in seconds) specified in the command-line. If no refresh period was specified, returns -1. The code assumes that the attributes have been successfully parsed.
        Returns:
        the specified refresh period in the command-line.

      • getExplicitBindDn

        public java.lang.String getExplicitBindDn()
        Returns the bind DN explicitly provided in the command-line.
        Returns:
        the bind DN explicitly provided in the command-line. Returns null if no bind DN was explicitly provided.

      • getDefaultBindDn

        public java.lang.String getDefaultBindDn()
        Returns the bind DN default value.
        Returns:
        the bind DN default value.
